TextView.android:text: The eruptions of the Yellowstone Supervolcano is consistent of rhyolitic lava flows, which are felsic lava flows, meaning that the lava flows are slow, but are still dangerous because they are explosive. The Yellowstone Volcano had 3 eruptions in the past with a magnitude above 8. The most recent eruption of the Yellowstone Volcano was 640,000 years ago, with a magnitude above 8. If the magnitude is above 8, the volcano is considered a supervolcano. It was this eruption which caused the land to collapse and formed the Yellowstone caldera.
